title: Dan and Nicole on The Mystery Hour
body:
Just a quick announcement: Nicole and I will be guests during this <strike>Saturday's</strike> Friday's "Mystery Hour" at The Skinny Improv, hosted by our good buddy Jeff Houghton (who has a dish named after him at Gailey's). It's an hour long late-night-talk-show-esque extravaganza! The show starts at 10:15 PM, and tickets are a measly $5.00. Jeff promises plenty of full facial nudity, but I still might show up without pants just to throw him off. Nude or not, it's going to be a blast, so if you're looking for something fun and different to do on <strike>Saturday</strike> Friday night (assuming you've seen both MAN ON WIRE and SYNECDOCHE, NEW YORK), swing by and catch the show.

In other news, I banged my head on a ceiling joist so violently today that I think I jarred something loose. Now the only thing I can smell is burnt ham.
author: Dan

comments.author: nate
comments.body: Jeeeez, Dan. Try to go two days without causing violent harm to your person. Steering wheel to the face, fiberglass-riddled bleeding lungs... not to mention the pistachios from way back. It's amazing you still walk upright. The Moxie's become your own personal CUBE-like deathtrap. (Just for Dan; not you, dear anonymous reader/customer).

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: It's not on Saturday, it's TONIGHT!

comments.author: SpeedyProductions
comments.body:
Dan and Nicole, it was cool seeing you at the Mystery Hour last night.  Previous to that I only knew your names, and I had seen your faces at the Moxie, but I was not smart enough to put the two together until tonight.  Sorry you passed out Nicole :(  lol.

-Speedy Gonzales

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Clarification: I did not pass out at The Mystery Hour!! But I did have butterflies in my stomach the whole time. I'm no good at being in front of crowds.
